<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[891, 182, 949, 195]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[39, 201, 80, 230]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 204, 169, 217]]<|/det|> NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[728, 219, 722, 237]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[512, 219, 722, 238]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[765, 216, 805, 241]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[891, 219, 949, 241]]<|/det|> <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 279, 350, 294]]<|/det|> # ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[827, 279, 907, 294]]<|/det|> 0606/13 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 304, 269, 317]]<|/det|> Paper 1 Non-calculator <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[785, 304, 907, 319]]<|/det|> May/June 2025 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[858, 328, 907, 341]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 357, 396, 371]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 386, 361, 399]]<|/det|> No additional materials are needed. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 419, 225, 432]]<|/det|> # INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 294, 450]]<|/det|> - Answer all questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 451, 761, 466]]<|/det|> - Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 481]]<|/det|> - Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 481, 565, 496]]<|/det|> - Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 497, 482, 512]]<|/det|> - Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 361, 528]]<|/det|> - Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 451, 543]]<|/det|> - Calculators must not be used in this paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 468, 559]]<|/det|> - You must show all necessary working clearly. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 589, 214, 602]]<|/det|> # INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 605, 388, 620]]<|/det|> - The total mark for this paper is 80. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 620, 730, 635]]<|/det|> - The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 76, 570, 91]]<|/det|>
List of formulas

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[86, 106, 479, 126]]<|/det|>
Equation of a circle with centre \((a, b)\) and radius \(r\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[603, 103, 787, 126]]<|/det|>
\[
(x-a)^{2}+(y-b)^{2}=r^{2}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[86, 158, 540, 175]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cone of radius \(r\), sloping edge \(l\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[607, 157, 678, 173]]<|/det|>
\[
A=\pi r l
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[86, 205, 377, 220]]<|/det|>
Surface area, \(A\), of sphere of radius \(r\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[607, 201, 687, 220]]<|/det|>
\[
A=4 \pi r^{2}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[86, 251, 501, 271]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of pyramid or cone, base area \(A\), height \(h\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[607, 244, 686, 276]]<|/det|>
\[
V=\frac{1}{3} A h
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[603, 290, 687, 321]]<|/det|>
\[
V=\frac{4}{3} \pi r^{3}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[86, 300, 340, 316]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of sphere of radius \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[86, 349, 236, 364]]<|/det|>
Quadratic equation

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 346, 659, 365]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(a x^{2}+b x+c=0\),

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 367, 562, 404]]<|/det|>
\[
x=\frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^{2}-4 a c}}{2 a}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[86, 449, 228, 464]]<|/det|>
Binomial theorem

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 435, 910, 526]]<|/det|>
\[
(a+b)^{n}=a^{n}+\binom{n}{1} a^{n-1} b+\binom{n}{2} a^{n-2} b^{2}+\ldots+\binom{n}{r} a^{n-r} b^{r}+\ldots+b^{n},
\quad \text { where } n \text { is a positive integer and } \binom{n}{r}=\frac{n !}{(n-r) ! r !}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[86, 554, 222, 569]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 552, 670, 599]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& u_{n}=a+(n-1) d \\
& S_{n}=\frac{1}{2} n(a+l)=\frac{1}{2} n\{2 a+(n-1) d\}
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[86, 630, 222, 647]]<|/det|>
Geometric series

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 628, 576, 710]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& u_{n}=a r^{n-1} \\
& S_{n}=\frac{a(1-r^{n})}{1-r} \quad(r \neq 1) \\
& S_{\infty}=\frac{a}{1-r} \quad(|r|<1)
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[86, 739, 161, 754]]<|/det|>
Identities

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 736, 559, 790]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& \sin ^{2} A+\cos ^{2} A=1 \\
& \sec ^{2} A=1+\tan ^{2} A \\
& \operatorname{cosec}^{2} A=1+\cot ^{2} A
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 829, 242, 844]]<|/det|>
Formulas for \(\Delta A B C\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 823, 581, 901]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& \frac{a}{\sin A}=\frac{b}{\sin B}=\frac{c}{\sin C} \\
& a^{2}=b^{2}+c^{2}-2 b c \cos A \\
& \Delta=\frac{1}{2} a b \sin C
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 105, 145, 120]]<|/det|>
1 (a)

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 123, 796, 446]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 464, 863, 482]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the graph of \(y=(2 x+a)(x+b)(x+c) \quad\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 495, 363, 512]]<|/det|>
Find values for \(a, b\) and \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 712, 587, 730]]<|/det|>
(b) Use the graph to find the values of \(x\) for which \(y \geqslant 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 791, 95]]<|/det|>
2 Find the values of \(k\) for which the equation \(x^{2}+4 k x+k+3=0\) has two equal roots．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 369, 689, 387]]<|/det|>
3 The polynomial p is such that \(\mathrm{p}(x)=x^{3}+A x+30\) ，where \(A\) is a constant． When \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x+2\) the remainder is 84 ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 418, 436, 434]]<|/det|>
Write \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) as a product of linear factors．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 545, 91]]<|/det|>
5 Solutions by accurate drawing will not be accepted.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 102, 535, 122]]<|/det|>
A circle, \(C\), has equation \((x-5)^{2}+(y-12)^{2}=100\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 136, 598, 153]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the equation of the tangent to \(C\) at the point \((11,4)\). Give your answer in the form \(a x+b y=c\), where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 519, 716, 540]]<|/det|>
(b) Show that \(C\) and the circle with equation \(x^{2}+y^{2}=4\) do not intersect.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 74, 701, 91]]<|/det|>
6 Find the \(x\)-coordinates of the points of intersection of the following curves.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[372, 97, 624, 136]]<|/det|>
\[
y=4 \ln x \text { and } y=5-\frac{3}{\ln \left(x^{2}\right)}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 136, 380, 153]]<|/det|>
Give your answers in exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 697, 91]]<|/det|>
7 In this question，all lengths are in centimetres and all angles are in radians．

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[347, 101, 650, 233]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 256, 634, 270]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a sector of a circle with centre \(O\) and radius 6 ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 283, 537, 302]]<|/det|>
（a）It is given that the area of triangle \(A O B\) is \(9 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 316, 338, 331]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\sin \theta\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 482, 741, 503]]<|/det|>
（b）It is also given that the exact area of the shaded segment is \((15 \pi-9) \mathrm{cm}^{2}\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 517, 435, 532]]<|/det|>
Find the exact length of the \(\operatorname{arc} A B\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 97, 90]]<|/det|>
8

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[295, 91, 701, 270]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 297, 562, 327]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y=\frac{3}{x+1}-\frac{x-2}{x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 336, 904, 352]]<|/det|>
The points \(A\) and \(B\) lie on the curve such that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(A\) is 1 and the \(x\)-coordinate of \(B\) is 2 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 367, 424, 384]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the \(y\)-coordinates of \(A\) and \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 490, 780, 506]]<|/det|>
(b) Show that the area of the shaded region enclosed by the line \(A B\) and the curve is \(\frac{a}{4}-\ln \frac{b}{2}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers to be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 650, 97]]<|/det|>
9 The function f is defined by \(\mathrm{f}(x)=-2 x^{2}+9 x-10\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 107, 715, 126]]<|/det|>
(a) (i) Write \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in the form \(a+b(x+c)^{2}\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 384, 533, 403]]<|/det|>
(ii) Hence determine whether or not \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\) exists.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 690, 93]]<|/det|>
(b) The function g is defined by \(\mathrm{g}(x)=3 \ln (5-2 x)\) for \(0 \leqslant x<2.5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[159, 107, 535, 123]]<|/det|>
(i) On the axes, sketch the graph of \(y=\mathrm{g}(x)\). State the exact values of the intercepts with the coordinate axes and the equation of any

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 138, 283, 155]]<|/det|>
asymptote.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[261, 185, 738, 524]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[152, 554, 432, 574]]<|/det|>
(ii) Find an expression for \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[147, 739, 465, 758]]<|/det|>
(iii) Find the domain and range of \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}\). Give each of your answers in exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 105, 88]]<|/det|>
10

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 90, 435, 325]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 345, 485, 360]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows four points，\(O, A, B\) and \(C\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 369, 581, 396]]<|/det|>
\(A, B\) and \(C\) lie in a straight line and are such that \(\frac{A B}{A C}=\frac{1}{3}\) ． \(\overrightarrow{O A}=\mathbf{a}\) and \(\overrightarrow{O B}=\mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 433, 388, 452]]<|/det|>
（a）Find \(\overrightarrow{O C}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\) ． Simplify your answer．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 672, 91]]<|/det|>
(b) The line \(O A\) is extended to the point \(D\) such that \(O A: A D=2: 7\). Point \(E\) lies on \(C D\) such that \(\overrightarrow{O E}=\lambda \mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 125, 311, 140]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\lambda\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 74, 678, 91]]<|/det|>
11 A particle \(P\) moves in a straight line and passes through a fixed point \(O\). At time \(t\) seconds, its displacement from \(O, s\) metres, is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[284, 115, 780, 175]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{array}{ll}
s=t+6 t^{2}-t^{3} & \text { for } 0 \leqslant t \leqslant 3 \\
s=12 t-\frac{1}{3} t^{2}-3 & \text { for } 3 \leqslant t \leqslant k \quad \text { where } k \text { is a constant }
\end{array}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 183, 813, 199]]<|/det|>
It is given that, for \(3 \leqslant t \leqslant k\), the velocity of \(P\) is positive and its acceleration is negative.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 213, 532, 230]]<|/det|>
(a) The maximum velocity of \(P\) occurs when \(t=2\). On the axes below, sketch a velocity-time graph for the first \(k\) seconds of the motion of \(P\).

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[262, 259, 736, 542]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 620, 91]]<|/det|>
(b) The total distance travelled by \(P\) for \(0 \leqslant t \leqslant k\) is 57 metres.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 105, 918, 122]]<|/det|>
Given that when \(t=3\) the distance and displacement of \(P\) from \(O\) are equal, find the value of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 76, 852, 108]]<|/det|>
12 The normal to the curve \(y=\frac{4}{x^{2}}+a x+7\) at the point where \(x=2\) has equation \(x+4 y=b\). Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).
